concepts.answer: the application of a systematic, disciplined, quantifiable approach to the development, operation, and maintenance of software; that is, the application of engineering to software.
concepts.question: What is software engineering?
concepts.title: Software Engineering

concepts.answer: an organizational function within a company dealing with new product development, business justification, planning, verification, forecasting, pricing, product launch, and marketing of a product or products at all stages of the product lifecycle.
concepts.question: What is product management?
concepts.title: Product Management

concepts.answer: Software requirements express the needs and constraints placed on a software product that contribute to the solution of some real-world problem.
concepts.question: What are software requirements?
concepts.title: Software Requirements

concepts.answer: A software requirement is a property that must be exhibited by something in order to solve some problem in the real world.
concepts.question: What is a software requirement?
concepts.title: Software Requirement

concepts.answer: A functional requirement describes the functions that the software is to execute.
concepts.question: What is a functional requirement?
concepts.title: Functional Requirements

concepts.answer: A functional nonrequirement describes constraints or quality requirements for a given solution.
concepts.question: What is a nonfunctional requirement?
concepts.title: Nonfunctional Requirements

concepts.answer: requirements that can not be addressed by a single component but that depend on how all the software components interoperate.
concepts.question: In software requirements what is an emergent property?

concepts.question: What are the primary ways classifying requirements?
concepts.answer:

concepts.title: Software testing
concepts.question: What is software testing?
concepts.answer: Dynamic verification that a program provides expected behaviors on a finite set of test cases, suitably selected from the usually infinite execution domain.

concepts.title: Software maintenance
concepts.question: What is software maintenance?
concepts.answer: The totality of activities required to provide cost-effective support to software.

concepts.title: Need for Maintenance
concepts.question: Why is maintenance needed?
concepts.answer: To ensure that the software continues to satisfy user requirements.

concepts.title: Software Engineering Models and Methods
concepts.question: What are software engineering models and methods?
concepts.answer: A structured approach to software engineering with the goal of making that activity systematic, repeatable, and ultimately more success-oriented.

concepts.title: Software Quality
concepts.question: What is software quality?
concepts.answer: ADD ANSWER

concepts.title: Software Engineering Professional Practice
concepts.question: What is software engineering professional practice?
concepts.answer: A knowledge area concerned with the knowledge, skills, and attitudes that software engineers must possess to practice software engineering in a professional, responsible, and ethical manner.

concepts.title: Using models in software engineering
concepts.question: Using models provides an approach to ...
concepts.answer: problem solving, a notation, and procedures for model construction and analysis.

concepts.title: Cell biology
concepts.question: What is cell biology?
concepts.answer: A branch of biology that studies the structure, function and behavior of cells.

concepts.title: Conceptual Modeling
concepts.question: What is a conceptual model?
concepts.answer: Models comprise entities from the problem domain, configured to reflect their real-world relationships and dependencies.
Systems engineering (SE) is a transdisciplinary approach and means to enable the realization of successful systems.
concepts.question: What is systems engineering?
concepts.title: Systems Engineering
Systems Satisfaction
concepts.question: What must a system satisfy to be considered successful?
concepts.answer: The needs of customers, users and other stakeholders.

concepts.title: Psychology
concepts.question: What is psychology?
concepts.answer: The science of mind and behavior.

concepts.title: Equanimity
concepts.question: What is equanimity?
concepts.answer: A state of psychological stability and composure which is undisturbed by experience of or exposure to emotions, pain, or other phenomena that may cause others to lose the balance of their mind.

concepts.title: Compassion
concepts.question: What is compassion?
concepts.answer: Compassion motivates people to go out of their way to help the physical, mental, or emotional pains of another and themselves.

concepts.title: Neuroscience
concepts.question: What is neuroscience?
concepts.answer: Neuroscience is the scientific study of the nervous system.

concepts.title: System
concepts.question: What is a system?
concepts.answer: A group of interacting or interrelated elements that act according to a set of rules to form a unified whole.

concepts.title: Systems Theory
concepts.question: What is systems theory?
concepts.answer: The interdisciplinary study of systems, which are cohesive groups of interrelated, interdependent parts that can be natural or human-made.
